timeline.bodyText:
Why new message? For this check, the lines and text blocks must be equal:
String str1 = "foo";
String str2 = """
                     foo
                     """; // violation
Now it turns out that the message is different depending on the order of the variables.

timeline.bodyText:
return the index of the first non-whitespace character, or line.length if no such character found?
I don't like this behavior. Let's return -1 if it fails to find any non-whitespace character.
In this case, the method getSmallestIndent can be
        return lines.stream()
                .mapToInt(CheckUtil::indexOfNonWhitespace)
                .filter(value -> value >= 0)
                .min()
                .orElse(0);
timeline.author: pbludov

replies.bodyText: Pitest shows that                 .filter(value -> value >= 0) has 6 surviving mutations; I removed that line and all tests still pass, as well as pitest now.

timeline.bodyText:
I think this replacement should be done for all types of strings.
Now it turns out that if the second occurrence is a text block, the ends of the lines are replaced. But if there is another occurrence of an ordinary string, the result will be as it is.

'
foo'
